channel.title: Spring
channel.description: Level up your Java code and explore what Spring can do for you.

item.title: Spring Authorization Server 2025-12 Releases
item.dc:creator: rwinch
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I am pleased to announce the availability of Spring Authorization Server 1.5.5, 1.5.4, 1.4.8, and 1.4.7. This set of releases includes bug fixes and back to back releases due do an error in the release process.

For a complete list of changes, refer to the changelogs:

  • 1.5.5
  • 1.5.4
  • 1.4.8
  • 1.4.7

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation

item.title: Spring Session 2025-12 Releases
item.dc:creator: rwinch
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I am pleased to announce the availability of Spring Session 4.0.1, 3.5.4, and 3.4.7. This set of releases includes bug fixes and dependency upgrades.

For a complete list of changes, refer to the changelogs:

  • 4.0.1
  • 3.5.4
  • 3.4.7

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation

item.title: This Week in Spring ? December 16th, 2025
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans! Welcome to another installment of This Week in Spring! And what a week it¡¯s been! We¡¯ve got around nine shopping days ¡¯til Christmas, and the New Year is almost here! Things are moving so quickly and the Spring community is no exception! Let's dive into this week's wonderful roundup!

  • This is a super interesting application of a design pattern with Spring AI¡¯s dynamic tool selection, described by Christian Tzolov.
  • Spring Tools 5.0 released.
  • Spring Shell 4.0.0-M2 is out!
  • In last week¡¯s installment of A Bootiful Podcast, I talked to Spring legend Rossen Stoyanchev about API versioning, declarative interface clients, RestTestClients, and more.
  • Spring AI 2.0.0-M1 available now.
  • Spring Framework 7.0.2 available now.
  • Spring Framework 6.2.15 available now.
  • Spring for GraphQL 1.3.7, 1.4.4, and 2.0.1 released.
  • Spring Web Services 4.0.17 available now.
  • Spring Security 2025-12 released.
  • Spring for Apache Pulsar 1.2.13 and 2.0.1 are now available.
  • Spring Cloud 2024.0.3 (aka Northfields) has been released.
  • Spring Data 2025.1.1, 2025.0.7, and 2024.1.13 released.
  • Spring Authorization Server 2025-12 releases.
  • Spring Session 2025-12 released.
  • Baeldung has a nice post on API versioning in Spring.
  • Good news, everybody! Spring gRPC has reached 1.0, and you can read about it in this blog.
  • I love this new post on AWS¡¯ blog by James Ward on MCP elicitations with Java and Spring AI.
  • This is a really nice supplementary layer for server-sent events in Spring Boot.
  • Piotr¡¯s tech blog has a nice post on transactions with Apache Kafka.
  • Are you using Micrometer? Got an unscratched itch? The Micrometer team is doing their planning and would love feedback on the next iteration. Sound off on GitHub!

item.title: Spring for GraphQL 1.3.7, 1.4.4 and 2.0.1 released
item.dc:creator: bclozel
item.content:encoded:
I am pleased to announce that the December Spring for GraphQL maintenance releases are now available on Maven Central.

Spring for GraphQL 1.3.7 ships a single dependency upgrade and will be shipped this week with Spring Boot 3.4.13. Spring for GraphQL 1.4.4 ships 6 fixes and upgrades and will be shipped this week with Spring Boot 3.5.9. Spring for GraphQL 2.0.1 ships 9 fixes and upgrades and will be shipped this week with Spring Boot 4.0.1.

As always, you can check the official Spring release calendar for upcoming releases.

How can you help?

If you have general questions, please ask on stackoverflow.com using the spring-graphql tag.

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation | Stack Overflow
